description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cajlp","text":"Three-dimensional (3D) cell culture technologies, which more closely mimic the complex microenvironment of tissue, are being increasingly evaluated as a tool for the preclinical screening of clinically promising new molecules, and for the study of tissue metabolism. Studies of metabolites released into the extracellular space (secretome) allow understanding the metabolic dynamics of tissues and changes caused by therapeutic interventions. Although quite advanced in the field of proteomics, studies on the secretome of low molecular weight metabolites (\u003c 1500 Da) are still very scarce. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1s9f","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c85e7","text":"We present an untargeted metabolomic protocol based on the hybrid technique of high-performance liquid- chromatography coupled with high-resolution mass spectrometry for the analysis of low-molecular-weight metabolites released into the culture medium by 3D cultures and coculture (secretoma model). For that, we analayzed HT-29 human colon carcinoma cells and 3T3-L1 preadipocytes in 3D-monoculture and 3D-coculture.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tnfi","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bao4k","text":"This protocol represents a possibility to list metabolites released in the extracellular environment in a comprehensive and untargeted manner, opening the way for the generation of metabolic hypotheses that will certainly contribute to the understanding of tissue metabolism, tissue-tissue interactions, and metabolic responses to the most varied interventions. Moreover,  it brings potential to determine novel pathways and identify accurate biomarkers in cancer and other diseases. The metabolites indicated in our study have a close relationship with the tumor microenvironment in accordance with the literature review.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"di074","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mb7d","text":"For the 3D cell culture by levitation we used Bio-Assembler™ system (Bio Science 662840, Greiner One Bio, Americana, Brazil) in the n3D Biosciences and adapted protocol published by:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fn2i","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4icbv","text":"HAISLER, W. L. et al. Three-dimensional cell culturing by magnetic levitation. Nature protocols, v. 8, n. 10, p. 1940-1949, 2013. https://doi.org/10.1038/nprot.2013.125","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":79,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":130,"length":38}],"data":{}},{"key":"60fr5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1634387C936F11ECA76A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1038/nprot.2013.125"}}}}

references.title: Three-dimensional cell culturing by magnetic levitation.
references.authors: Haisler WL, Timm DM, Gage JA, Tseng H, Killian TC, Souza GR

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cjoe0","text":"Use human colon carcinoma (HT-29) and pre-adipocytes cells (3T3-L1) (Banco de Células do Rio de Janeiro (BCRJ; Duque de Caxias, Brazil).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e1ade","text":"Acquire the spectra  under the acquisition mass range of 50-1200 Da, using the MSE approach (6 V for low energy and a 15-30 V ramp for high energy scanning).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":81,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3kelv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1gj7q","text":"Use a    sodium formate solution  for instrument calibration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dem87","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"11D9CF80725011ECB21645AE3EB00AB3","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}}}}

steps.section: DATA PROCESSING AND POTENTIAL IDENTIFICATION OF COMPOUNDS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cs0pu","text":"Process the raw data with Progenesis IQ (Waters) software for peak detection, alignment, integration, deconvolution, data filtering, ion annotation, and MSE based putative identification of compounds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":155,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DATA PROCESSING AND POTENTIAL IDENTIFICATION OF COMPOUNDS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"86p2c","text":"Use the following databases to suggest the identifications : Lipid Maps (http://www.lipidmaps.org/), LipidBlast (https://fiehnlab.ucdavis.edu/projects/LipidBlast) and Human Metabolome Database (http://www.hmdb.ca/metabolites). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":73,"length":25},{"key":1,"offset":113,"length":48},{"key":2,"offset":194,"length":30}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5564E7B7740211EC81520A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://www.lipidmaps.org"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5564E82F740211EC81520A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://fiehnlab.ucdavis.edu/projects/LipidBlast"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5564E8AC740211EC81520A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://www.hmdb.ca/metabolites"}}}}

steps.section: DATA PROCESSING AND POTENTIAL IDENTIFICATION OF COMPOUNDS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"abp90","text":"Use the following parameters for identification : mass error of the precursor ≤ 5 ppm, mass error of the fragment ≤ 10 ppm, mass precision, and isotopic similarity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5360a","text":"Perform the volcano plot statistical test  between all culture conditions and in the presence and absence (white samples) of the cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ksgq","text":"Rank the relevant molecular features  according to the false discovered ratio (FDR) and log2 fold change (FC) values.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7gks","text":"Consider only the molecular features that presented FDR value \u003c 0.05 and log2 FC\u003e0 when compared to the secretome of the culture medium (white), In the assignment of cell secretomes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kgcr","text":"Thaw HT-29 and 3T3-L1 cells and propagate in culture using Modified Dulbecco Eagle Medium (DMEM - Sigma D-5648, São Paulo, Brazil), supplement with   sodium pyruvate (Gibco -11- 360, Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, Massachusetts, USA),   fetal bovine serum (Gibco 2010-09, Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, Massachusetts, USA) and   antibiotics (  of penicillin and   of streptomycin (Gibco 15140-122, Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, Massachusetts, USA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":148,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":239,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":335,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":350,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":370,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9lmv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"E4F58DC077D511ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"BA3B913077D811ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"CAC03C4077D811ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"92E909F077D811ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1846}},"4":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"804F3A8077D811ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":204}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fg2ol","text":"Culture cells in a humidified chamber with  CO2 (HeraCELL 150) at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":46,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":66,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4f9bi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"2316C24077DB11ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7634C0A077D911ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ep9l","text":"Incubate cell cultures with   trypsin-EDTA   (Gibco 25 200, Fisher Scientific, Waltham, Massachusetts, USA) at   for three minutes to allow cell disaggregation and propagation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":111,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9d35b","text":"Use DMEM plus 10% FBS to inactivate trypsin. Transfer the cell pellet to a new 75 cm3 flask (T75) containing   DMEM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":84,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":109,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7cak9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"B908CBA077DA11ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.25","error_concentration":false,"guid":"C667A5A077DA11ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F2F9F36092AC11EC9771F7EC2EAA25EB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"38AA521092A811EC8B6AB311A738729C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f9gg4","text":"Change the culture medium according to the cell doubling time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9r7bu","text":"Determine cell viability in a Neubauer chamber using Trypan Blue (Gibco 15250061, Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, Massachusetts, USA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jm39","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61rab","text":"Use Bio-Assembler™ system (Bio Science 662840, Greiner One Bio, Americana, Brazil) in the n3D Biosciences 24-well configuration (HAISLER et al., 2013).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1t598","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"29trh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Haisler WL, Timm DM, Gage JA, Tseng H, Killian TC, Souza GR","can_edit":1,"date":"1380585600","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1038/nprot.2013.125","guid":"9BEED3F077E111ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":1476,"journal":"Nature protocols","protocol_id":"0","title":"Three-dimensional cell culturing by magnetic levitation."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c2a30","text":"Culture HT- 29 cells (passage 12th) in monolayer culture at T75 flask.  Determine the cell viability (\u003e75%) in a Neubauer chamber, when the cells confluence reaches 80%-90%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dii9n","text":"Place a magnetic coupling driver under the plate for  and incubate it in the humidified chamber with  CO2 (HeraCELL 150) at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":104,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":100,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":124,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5i3u9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":18000,"guid":"1963DFA077E311ECB6079F2B0550C239","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"4138CA1492A111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8ED36B0F92A111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1vpsb","text":"Close the plate and place the levitation drive atop the intermediate lid to levitate the cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s6cv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fh9gb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9sd40","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4q6u1","text":"If the cells not immediately levitate gently shake the plate moving it to back and forth, until they levitate","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fgskn","text":"Add 3T3-L1 spheroid suspension in each well of cell repellent HT-29 wells plate using a magnetic pen, 21 days after the beginning of HT-29 spheroid formation and keep it for 7 days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jkj","text":"Culture 3T3-L1 cells   in monolayer to 90% confluence and cell viability (\u003e75%), and incubate in a  supplemented medium in repellent hanging drop plate at  /  CO2/  humidity and monitore until the aggregates have formed and differentiated to adipocytes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":20,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":155,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":157,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":163,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1tjtd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"600","error":false,"guid":"1E06842092A711ECB079D309CE0A63D2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8139289091F311ECA8E4CFA56F846599","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"836058E091F411ECA8E4CFA56F846599","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"3":{"type":"humidity","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"95","guid":"8D7BA0A091F411ECA8E4CFA56F846599","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81of","text":"Prepare the magnetic nanoparticles by removing it from the refrigerator and thawing it at room temperature    for about 15 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":107,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"crpu9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"DC8AEAF092AA11EC9771F7EC2EAA25EB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"20-25","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a47ji","text":"Add    of magnetic nanoparticles (Nanoshuttle™- PL, Greiner)  in the single cell suspension flask, homogenize gently the suspension and centrifuge  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":60,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":147,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5jkk4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"0AED77B1935611ECA76A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"per 10.000 cells","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"1500","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"64E85B0091FF11ECB7C04F8FF52CA7C3","id":0,"label":"3 times","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59g26","text":"Resuspend the cells and fill each well of cell-repellent 24-well plate with an amount of solution necessary to reach 7.5 x 103 cells, after centrifugation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":125,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqg0r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"30do9","text":"Complete with  of supplemented medium Modified Dulbecco Eagle Medium (DMEM - Sigma D-5648, São Paulo, Brazil), supplement with   sodium pyruvate (Gibco -11- 360, Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, Massachusetts, USA),   fetal bovine serum (Gibco 2010-09, Fisher Scientific, Waltham, Massachusetts, USA) and   antibiotics (  of penicillin and  of streptomycin) (Gibco 15140-122, Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, Massachusetts, USA) to a volume of  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":127,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":218,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":307,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":322,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":342,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":448,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ek88g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"9B55B85092A811EC8B6AB311A738729C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"F2B01AF792A111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"F2B01BAA92A111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"F2B018BF92A111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"4":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"F2B0198F92A111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1846}},"5":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"F2B01A4592A111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":204}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"A40FE97092A811EC8B6AB311A738729C","id":0,"label":"/well","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"491vb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bk95i","text":"Keep the magnetic coupling drive for 7 days. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oj75","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1g93b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"119md","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o893","text":"Use the field microscopy to verify the cohesion of the structures formed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38kns","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qipq","text":"Collect the culture medium whenever the exchange is necessary. To do it, use the holding drive to hold the 3D culture down while aspirating the liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
